summary: This document consists of six 30-minute inmate check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York for August 10, 2019. The sheets record staff observations of inmates in continuous lockdown status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, across tiers G, H, J, K, L, and M. The document is significant as it provides a detailed log of the prison's monitoring procedures on the day Jeffrey Epstein died in custody.

events.title: Daily Inmate Monitoring Logs
events.description: Routine 30-minute observation checks of inmates in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York were conducted and documented across multiple tiers.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a set of prison logs from the MCC New York Special Housing Unit dated August 10, 2019.
It details a mandatory observation protocol requiring staff to visually check inmates in lockdown status at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The logs cover six specific tiers (G, H, J, K, L, M) within the Special Housing Unit.
The document is marked 'CONFIDENTIAL' and originates from the files of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY).
The date of the logs coincides with the day Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell at the MCC.
